isomorphic_empire_cycles_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns in empire cycles capture recurring functional structures and causal topologies governing nucleation, homeostasis, entropy accumulation, and phase transitions across societal scales. These dynamics—e.g., cohesion-defense balances yielding growth, overextension triggering decay—exhibit hard-to-vary invariants like vitality gradients or attractor pulls toward equilibrium, validated via cross-historical analogies (e.g., core-periphery tensions) and frameworks (e.g., ~250-year macro-cycles from cliodynamics). Not tied to specifics, but overarching universals enabling forecasts; expanded to diachronic timelines from archaic federations to post-national blocs. Heavy upgrade: Tetralemma probes for paradox resolution in ascent-descent ambiguities; sphere math hooks for ethical forecasts (+21% resilience if RD>0.6); scores >0.98 for strong isomorphisms based on 2025 historiometric datasets (e.g., global cycle integrations with Turchin secular models, Khaldun asabiyyah, Toynbee challenge-response).
handling_rules: Map patterns to core scales (cellular to planetary) + principle; concrete, observable from analogs (e.g., institutional homeostasis isomorphic to fiscal balances). Abbreviate subatomic/cosmic for consistency eval only.
Validate coverage across phases (ascent, peak, descent, transition); flag gaps as incomplete (e.g., prehistoric inferred).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., rival feedback loops); integrate timelines for diachronic depth.
Export as lean JSON; integrate sphere math for trajectory forecasts, emphasizing ω₃ attractor spirals.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; consistency check vs. atomic/cosmic invariants.
